subject: Re: [junit] Re: Compiling JUnit
msgSnippet: f.s., Maybe your runtime and JDK have different versions?  What does javac -version give you? David Saff ... [Non-text portions of this message have been
messageBody:
f.s.,

Maybe your runtime and JDK have different versions? What does javac
-version give you?

David Saff

On 4/2/07, fstatovci <fstatovci@...> wrote:
>
>
> Mark, thanks for the response. I believe that my class path is setup
> correctly, since when i run
> java org.junit.runner.JUnitCore org.junit.tests.AllTests
>
> it passes with no error.
>
> I printed the class path and this is what I got.
>
> C:\junit4.3.1>echo %CLASSPATH%
> .;C:\Program
> Files\Java\jre1.5.0_06\lib\ext\QTJava.zip;C:\junit4.3.1\junit-4.3.1
> .jar;C:\junit4.3.1\
>
> Regarding the Java version I got 1.5.0_11 but still it can't recognize
> the annotations for some reason.
>
> Let me know what do you think.
>
> f.s.
>
>
>
>
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Mark Salter <marksalter@...> wrote:
> >
> > fstatovci wrote:
> > > Ok. Here is whats happening.
> > >
> > > Junit has a samples directory under org/junit/samples. I modified the
> > > file called SimpleTest.java and tried to compile it using javac
> > > SimpleTest.java
> > [snip]
> >
> > > SimpleTest.java:3: <identifier> expected
> > > import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;
> > > ^
> > > SimpleTest.java:3: '.' expected
> > > import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;
> >
> > The faq (in particular):-
> >
> > http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#started_2
> >
> > includes information about setting your classpath to include the
> > junit.jar files. This will allow the compiler to know about the junit
> > classes and make them available for import.
> >
> > > ^
> > > SimpleTest.java:16: illegal character: \64
> > > @Before public void setUp() {
> > > ^
> > What version of java are you using?
> >
> > typing :-
> > java -version
> >
> > at the command prompt will give you this. Are you using a build older
> > than 1.5? If so you need to bring your JDK up to date, so it knows what
> > to do with annotations (@Before).
> >
> >
> > --
> > Mark
> >
>
>
>
>
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
